Reviews.Title: “Review of Eurostars Parc del Valles, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey W
Reviews.Content: The price was very reasonable for five nights, however it was far away from the city centre. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel and one right down the road, so that was convenient if you are taking the bus, which my friend and I did to get to the train station. There was no free breakfast, which was a bummer, but the hotel offered a computer that had high speed Internet and we got a couple of free maps of Barcelona. I would stay here again and would recommend it for those who don't mind travelling outside the city to get back to their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not even three stars”
Reviews.Author: srgy
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel!!! Not even a three star hotel. Smells cigarets in nonsmoking rooms, damaged rooms, far away from Barcelona, you hear everything what is happening in neighbor rooms, awful beds ;(

Reviews.Title: “Best price hotel but far away”
Reviews.Author: herolina
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband enjoyed our stay at this hotel however the hotel was far away from the centre of Barcelona.We mostly ask a taxi because we were four so it took 6 euro per person.But there is a bus stop in front of the hotel which we didn't use.There is a small bar opposite of the reception which you can taste Spanish or international beers or benefit a limited food menu.The reception and Lobby Bar staff were friendly,the housekeeping done their work well which we gave tips.The inernet was free and the breakfast was various.The pastries was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Best you can get for this price”
Reviews.Author: GenevieveP1985
Reviews.Content: For this price this is one of the best hotels you can get in Barcelona. We first booked a hostel downtown but I had been reading so many horrible stories about it, I opted for at least a 4* hotel. The gym was indeed run down but I dont think this is the most important thing. The young man at the reception was very friendly and helped us out with train schedules etc.In the small village there is a supermarket and little spots to eat very cheap and good. In Barcelona you will get ripped off badly for even a snack.OK, it is far and you DO have to walk and take a train but the weather is so nice it doesnt matter. It was a daily great workout , better than the gym :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but hard to find directions there”
Reviews.Author: arbrown10
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel- especially having the pool to ourselves in the morning! However, we were anxious about staying there because it was hard to find anyone to give us directions, and what we did find was contradictory. This is how we got there in the end: - Go to Fabra i Puig metro station in Barcelona (on the L1 line) - Get the A4 bus from the bus station directly above the metro station- this comes approximately every 40 minutes. - The bus stops directly outside of the hotel. Ask for a ticket to the hotel, and watch out for the entrance to the Technology Park- the stop is immediately after you turn into the park. You have to request to stop. The village that the hotel is in (Cerdanyola del Valles) is very pleasant and has a lovely bakery near the hotel. There are many bars which do good tapas menus at very reasonable prices. We found the locals to be very friendly although with no English. It was a relaxing place to start and end the day after the crowds and constant barrage of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price- a car is a must!”
Reviews.Author: Jourak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great for its value. However, having a car is a must which is really cheap in Barcelona! Do not take the breakfast at all! You will be pissed off as it does not worth it at all. You pay 11€ for having nothing. Also consider taking a small kettel as hotel does not have a kettel in its room. However, in general this place is great to stay and I do reccommemd it. The staff are so mice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “28km from city and 30 mins walk from train station... Not good if you're alone!!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkelladeville
Reviews.Content: I didn't do my homework before booking this place and should have!! The hotel itself reminds me of a travelodge.... Great value for money but never where you need it to be!! It cost me €65 to get from the airport alone which was re warning bell!! The staff are great and amenities are OK... But get yourself bearer town!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Barca”
Reviews.Author: Inter111
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Spain (barcellona) and I think that it is a lovely place to be but beware as nearly nobody speaks any different language apart from spanish, and with that i mean hotel people, people in tourism industry and even signs in hotels, restaurants, train stations and everything is in spanish. If you dont speak spanish be careful. Traveled with ryanair to Girona airport and hires a car from Solmar Car rental. This is a company which I got to know through cartrawler.com. I booked a car through this web site and as I arrived in Girona I found my car waiting for me, exactly as i asked for with a gps and all. I really recomend this company. Stayed at eurostars parc del valles. It is nowhere near the centre of barcellona, as by car we had to drive for nearly half an hour and if you dont have a car there is a walk of nearly 45 minutes to the nearest train station. I found the hotel very comfortable tough as our plan was not just to visit barcellona but also to visit Monserrat, porto avventura, some museums in the area and music concerts and Girona and this hotel was right in the middle of everything. The restaurant and the only restaurant was closed for dinner on certain nights and we were offered dinner in the lounge. One time we ate there but the food was nothing special, dont order veal as well as they serve beef instead and charge for veal steak. The waiter wAS NICE TOUGH The pool is small but nice and clean and the gym is quite old fashioned. Not 4 star to me, more like 2/3. It seems like that the hotel is run with 2 staff members. David and lourdes from the reception. They are exceptional, very nice, efficiant and although they are very busy because they are taking care of the reception, being as porters and even taking care of the lounge bar at the same time -), they go out of their way to help and meet guest expectations. David really helped us a lot and from here I would like to thank him again, especially as he has great knowledge of the area and he speaks english. Again make sure you have a car with a gps if you are going to stay in this hotel or you will waste lots of time walking and finding roads. To eat go to the centre of cerdanola next to the train station called kebab house and they serve very good food and good service and they have got a very nice waitress who speaks english, probably the only one who speaks english in that area, She helps a lot too. one thing I dont understand is why in spain, especially in tourist areas they dont employ people who speak English instead of just Spanish. it was the thing that bothered us most as it made our holiday really hard at times trying to understand people in spanish and they expect us to understand.

Reviews.Title: “Far from Barcelona, but Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: oliviapulley
Reviews.Content: We were so relieved to finally stay at an affordable nice hotel in Spain--with free parking. The big rooms appear brand new--big tvs, huge comfortable beds, funky bathrooms with see-through walls and new fixtures, free internet in the lobby. I would say this is only a 3.5-stars (not 4 as everything claims), given its horrible location in an industrial park far from the train and barcelona and lack of certain amenties that 4-stars have--lots of toiletries, concierge, free shuttles to train, etc. Also, no breakfast included and the gym is really weird and run-down (actually tried the sauna and worried about health & safety and burning the hotel down)--with great cardio machines but like they inherited the rest from a gym that went bust in the early '80s. It's obvious problem is its distance from everything--but the bigger problem is that many tourists seem to choose it and the staff are not very familiar with the bus and train services. We had to rush to make the last bus at 10:30 p.m., seriously cutting out our hopes of Barcelona nightlife. But the front desk made efforts to get us needed information and the bus to downtown leaves from right outside. It's convenient to road to Girona airport and on the north side of Barcelona, but do take your satnav to find the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Four stars no way!”
Reviews.Author: GODFREYUk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on easyjet. The hotel looks nice, but beware: It is a long way out of Barcelona, 30 minutes to walk to the station and then 20 minutes on the train. The hotel has a big gym, but it is very poorly maintained. The pulleys would appear to have never been greased, so the machines all stick. This ruins the whole experience. But by far the worst aspect is the FOOD, the breakfast was very poor and always stone-cold, and I mean STONE-COLD, how this then gets four stars is beyond me, this wrecked our break. I found a dead fly in my cereal dish, which were dirty having been washed - yesterdays food dried on. The mats on the sun-loungers at the pool were filthy. In all I would not recommend this hotel, if you want to visit Barcelona then stay nearer to the centre as this hotel will detract from a truly great city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, hotel but too far out for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Tidla
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel well in advance but didnt really realise how far out from the centre of Barcelona the hotel really was. The taxi man had a little trouble finding the hotel from the airport and it cost us 39 euros. The hotel itself was very quiet. I think we were one of maybe 20 or 30 guests staying in the hotel. The outside and lobby areas were clean and tidy. The hotel had some redecoration work going on inside on the corridors. The hotel does need a bit of re-modernising but it was fine. The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms were love;y. It has a nice gym that you can use and an outside pool which wasnt open due to it being out of season. We stayed half board and got a pretty good deal. Breakfast was ok and lunch or dinner would have been fab for me only i completely hate fish and thats all that was on the menu. Some of the waitressing staff didnt speak english so i ended up eating bread rolls and a desert for my dinner, and the free bottle of wine! But if you enjoy fish then the food looked amazing. We usually got the bus which was a 5min walk from the hotel into fabra i puig. It cost 1.85 euros. From fabra we got the metro into town for around a euro. The buses were frequent enough but it did take around half and hour. Myself and my partner were there for sightseeing but with the hotel being so far out it was a bit restricting. However we did have a great time and would definately recommend going on the Bus Turistic which takes you on 3 different routes around the city . It is the best way to see it and its cheap enough 23 euros for 2 days. You can get on and off wherever you like. Just to note , all museums are closed on mondays which we were disapointed about and the Tibadado (highest peak in barcelona where you can get a tram from) is only open at weekends! Barcelona is a great city but if you are going to do the touristy thing dont stay in this hotel, stay somewhere closer to La Rambla (main touristy place) or by the port.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: YoungIrishman
Reviews.Content: I simply feel compelled to write about this hotel. We have stayed at this hotel a number of times and I just feel that it is hard if near impossible to get better value at any other hotel in Spain. We paid 50euro per night (room only) for our stay here. It is a 4 star hotel and is just off the A7 motorway which runs from France to Alicante. The hotel is very clean. There is free internet access in what they call 'the internet corner' near reception. Staff could not be more helpful. Reception area is nice and very clean. They have a bar/cafe area at reception which is never very busy. The rooms are large and spacious but definately are far too brown in colour. The airconditioning works well. There is a minibar with spacious fridge in the room. There is also internet access in the rooms but you must pay 22 euro per day for that. The pool is never too busy and the water appears clean. It is quite difficult to find the hotel. It is probably easiest to get to if you head for Sant Cugat and then head for Cerdanyola from there; you should pass the hotel on your way. Cerdanyola itself has very little to offer. There is an Irish bar unfortunately called 'The 1916' there which is very nice. The train from Cerdanyola into Barcelona costs just €1.30 per adult one way and takes about 20/25 mins. If you want to enjoy a nice hotel at a reasonable price, it is hard to beat it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: touchango
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner on a dinner, bed and breakfast basis the night before we flew back to the UK. We just really wanted somewhere to crash before going to the airport and the hotel provided that. The hotel itself was in an industrial area so not really much use for people wanting to see the city of Barcelona but we knew how far it was from the centre before we booked and we had already seen all of Barcelona the week before. If you stay at this hotel have a car as otherwise it won't be any good to you. The room size was good and had a huge bed. Everything was clean and well maintained. There was free internet access in the lobby and we used this to catch up with emails. The included meal was from a set menu (3 choices of each course) which was great for one night but I understand that it didn't change that much so not much good if you are staying multiple nights. We also had a nice bottle of wine and this was included in the cost of the room deal. The breakfast was also fine, but not everything was topped up all the time so get there early to get the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of no where”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend on 27/12/04 for new years for 5 nights. I don't think we could have stayed in a worse location. We booked with lastminute and they stated it was prominently located in the heart of Barca, like --... It's basically the next town outside of Barcelona, Cerdanyola. It's a 30 minute walk to the train station which then takes further 30 minutes to reach the city centre. There's bus down the road from the hotel but they're infrequent, cabs will cost 25 euros to get to the centre. We stayed on a breakfast & dinner basis inclusive basis, breakfast was a continental buffet where the cooked food was cold and not replaced after the arrogant/rude german guests ate it all with their quadruple servings.. For dinner there was a fixed a la carte menu which was ok on the first night. But the hotel kept the same menu for 2nd, 3rd & 4th nights irregardless of complaints made. They displayed alternative menus but refused to let you order as they didn't have the ingredients to cook with?? Reception was passing blame on kitchen, and kitchen staff likewise. No one taking reponsibility for the administrative errors and lack of organisation, and also no managment in sight. After the 2nd night, we ended up having breakfast, dinner etc in town and purely used the hotel for sleep. Never the less the rooms were of a good standard, and cleaned regularly. I wouldn't stay here again as it's far too much aggrovation travel wise, will definately be more central next time...

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay..too far from the city”
Reviews.Author: RIUOchoRiosBride
Reviews.Content: I stayed here July 18-23 2004. This is a great hotel...reasonably priced (60 euros) and I would recommend it to anyone who has rented a car in Barcelona. However, if you do not have a car for your stay (I did not) then stay closer to the central area of Barcelona (Catyluna). In order to get there you must take a regional train from Place de Catyluna to Cerdanyola..which is about 25-30 mins. then take a 7 min taxi ride to the hotel. Travel cost about 20 euros per day for 2 people. The train stops running at 11pm and if you are still downtown you will have to take a taxi back to the hotel...30 euros later you will wish you had listened to me. The hotel does not tell you how far they are and even if you questions them extensively they will lie (they lied to me twice about it). It may be a bit more expensive to stay downtown but it makes more sense if you think about how much money you have spent travelling. Also... I would recommend eating elsewhere...I order a piza as a snack and I was presented with a long hair wrapped around my pepperoni. I would probably stay at this hotel again if i had a car..if you are travelling on a budget...stay elsewhere..it will be cheaper.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Hotel Parc del Valles
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Artesans 2-8, 08290 Barcelona, Spain (Formerly Parc del Vallès Hotel)
